Posts.Title: new member

Posts.Content: Age : 79 1/2 RPR : Nov., 2010 Gleason score after surgical path : 9 No nodal involvement but tumor invading perineural capsules bilaterally PSA pre-op : 5.6 PSA 6 weeks post-op : 3.4 Lupron, Casodex started; radiation refused PSA has been undetectable for 3 years since Lupron began until Oct. 2013 : 0.01 PSA two weeks ago : 1.2 We are set to see an oncologist and radiation oncologist after a PSA redraw in 3 weeks. Casodex was stopped. Has anyone been in a similar situation and the withdrawal of Casodex helped lower the PSA? How bad are the side effects with radiation? I would sure appreciate any thoughts or comments on the position I'm in. And if anyone has been "here" and can give insights as to what to expect. Thanks so much.

Posts.Content: I'm the 'dad', and would like to know if there are cases where intermittent Lupron has proven useful. If the psa rise is partly due to Cassodex, I might consider staying off Lupron for six months. But would like to know if this drug recovers it's effectiveness after an interruption. Any experience out there ?
Posts.Title: My dad
